sub_title: Sustainable policies consultant | PhD in Environmental Policy | Looking for positions in climate, urban or sustainability consulting
summary:
•	Well-rounded urban, climate and sustainability policy expert with over ten years of international professional experience in private, non-profit and academic sectors. 

•	Experience in project management, policy design and analysis, basic and applied research, knowledge sharing, and program coordination with public, private and academic stakeholders over multi-cultural environments.

•	Doctor in Environmental Policy (expected Nov, 22) with a Masters in Economy, and a Master in Global Studies and Police focused on International Cooperation for Development, as well as an Environmental Engineer bachelor. I trained in Project Management, Team Building, Complex Systems, and Scenario Analysis, among others. 

Looking for new challenges in the areas of urban climate and sustainability policy with an international outlook in the private or non-profit sector. 

Thematic expertise
•	Sustainable development
•	Climate change
•	Urban policies
•	Sustainable mobility
•	Urban development
•	International cooperation

Skills
•	Project management & team building
•	Quantitative and qualitative analysis
•	Policy and economic analysis
•	Research (basic and applied)
•	Negotiation and strategic planning
•	Capacity building & knowledge sharing

projects.title: Hacia Ciudades Competitivas Bajas en Carbono
projects.description:
Presenta un nuevo modelo de ciudad para nuestro país: bajo en carbono, viable social y económicamente, con alternativas de desarrollo que permitan combatir el cambio climático y crear empleos.
Evidencia los impactos económicos y ambientales del modelo actual de desarrollo y calcula los beneficios de establecer el modelo competitivo que se propone. Contiene la aplicación del modelo a dos desarrollos inmobiliarios y los beneficios derivados.

CEO en Centro de Transporte Sustentable, México

projects.title: Desarrollo Orientado al Transporte Sustentable (DOTS)
projects.description:
Desarrollo Orientado al Transporte Sustentable (DOTS) o Transit-Oriented Development (TOD) es
un modelo urbano con planeación y diseño en torno al transporte público, que construye barrios compactos, de alta densidad, que permiten a las personas gozar de diversidad de usos, servicios y espacios públicos seguros y activos, favoreciendo la interacción social.

Es una estrategia integral que da soluciones a la movilidad local y regional, ya que satisface la mayor parte de las necesidades de sus habitantes, de manera peatonal o ciclista en los niveles locales, y los conecta con el resto de la ciudad o la región por medio del transporte
público de calidad. De este modo reduce al máximo la dependencia del automóvil.

Los Barrios DOTS contribuyen en la transformación hacia ciudades seguras, competitivas y con alta calidad de vida.

profile_positions.description: Coordinated and successfully completed projects on sustainable urban policies
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•	Led the Capacity Building Program, training over 100 local government officials from over five countries in the Asia-Pacific region annually.
•	Coordinated the Safer Cities Program Coordinator (with UN-Habitat and Seoul Metropolitan Government), supporting the coordination between international partners, strategic planning, and documentation.
•	Supervised four thematic clusters led in four different countries and involving over 130 cities and organizations in the Asia-Pacific region.
profile_positions.title: Senior Program Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Developed baseline and carbon reduction potential models to evaluate mobility and urban development policies.
•	Managed knowledge-sharing mechanisms for Latin America and the Caribbean in climate finance and international mechanisms.
•	Developed studies related to National Appropriate Mitigation Actions (NAMAs).
profile_positions.title: Consultant in Economy and Environmental Engineering

profile_positions.description: Researched “Transport Oriented Development as an Urban Green Growth Strategy: The Human Perspective”

profile_positions.description: Analyzed South Korea’s Green Growth Policy

profile_positions.company: WRI Ross Center for Sustainable Cities
profile_positions.description:
Urban Mobility and Development Area: 
•	Estimated greenhouse gas emissions and cost effects of urban development patterns and its relation with urban mobility in Mexico, as part of the “Towards Low Carbon Competitive Cities” Project. 
•	Developed indicators to evaluate urban and socioeconomic characteristics. 

Air Quality and Climate Change Area: 
•	Developed a greenhouse gas emissions baseline for the transport sector in Mexico and analyzed policies by testing different policy scenarios. 
•	Designed international cooperation tools for climate change such as Nationally Appropriated Mitigation Actions (NAMAs) for the transport sector.
profile_positions.title: Environmental Engineer and Economy Senior Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Worked at the Applied Research in Environmental Engineering area at ITESO in the following areas:
•	Hydrology simulations for environmental impact assessment studies of dams. 
•	Environmental impact assessment mainly in hydrology section

volunteer_experiences.role: Coordinador Internacional de Asuntos Ambientales y Ecológicos; y Representante en Países Bajos

volunteer_experiences.description:
Member of Rotary Club Utrecht International since 2019, I became chair of the Recruitment and Membership Committee in September 2020.
In 2020 I also initiated and coordinated a campaign to raise funds to support hospitals in Mexico fighting with COVID in collaboration with Rotary Club Plaza de la República D.4170

volunteer_experiences.role: President, Fundraising Committee, Social Community Committee

company.name: Seoul Rotary Club - Young Leaders Club

volunteer_experiences.description:
Co-President, Feb 17 - Jun 17
Fundraising Committee Co-chair and Social Community Committee Co-Char, Jul, 16 - Jan, 17
Fundraising Committee Chair - Jan, 16 to Jul, 16

It was great to connect with young people and help them get interested in environmental issues. I could use my creativity and technical knowledge to come up with fun ways to get them closer to environmental challenges. Furthermore I met some awesome volunteers and staff, that helped me grow in many ways.

Periodic contributions providing an expertise point of view to the environmental challenges of Mexico City.

company.name: Red de Talentos Mexicanos en Países Bajos (Mexican Talent Network in the Netherlands)

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Red de Talentos Mexicanos, Korea Chapter is a network of Mexican professionals aimed at linking Mexican Professionals in Korea as well as supporting projects for Mexican development. 

This chapter is part of Red Global MX, a global network of Mexican professionals composed by over 50 chapters around the world.
